femtoscope.core.simu

Created on Fri Jan 28 15:32:37 2022

Simulation engine (bounded or unbounded domains, linear or nonlinear PDEs...). Reminder for getting matrix / rhs vector: https://github.com/sfepy/sfepy/issues/565

05/2022 update note

In the past, femtoscope used to re-assemble all matrices and vectors at each iteration of the Newton method (and even at each ping-pong iteration!), which is computationally inefficient. This problem can be circumvented by re- assembling only the iteration-dependent terms. An important portion of the program was edited in order to make this performance enhancement.

@author: hlevy

   1# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
   2"""
   3Created on Fri Jan 28 15:32:37 2022
   4
   5Simulation engine (bounded or unbounded domains, linear or nonlinear PDEs...).
   6Reminder for getting matrix / rhs vector:
   7https://github.com/sfepy/sfepy/issues/565
   8
   905/2022 update note
  10-------------------
  11In the past, femtoscope used to re-assemble all matrices and vectors at each
  12iteration of the Newton method (and even at each ping-pong iteration!), which
  13is computationally inefficient. This problem can be circumvented by re-
  14assembling only the iteration-dependent terms. An important portion of the
  15program was edited in order to make this performance enhancement.
  16
  17@author: hlevy
  18"""
  19
  20import os
  21
  22# from sfepy.solvers.auto_fallback import AutoDirect
  23from sfepy.solvers.ls import ScipyDirect #, ScipyIterative
  24from sfepy.solvers.nls import Newton
  25from sfepy.base.base import IndexedStruct
  26from sfepy.discrete import Equations, Problem, Function
  27from sfepy.discrete.conditions import (Conditions, EssentialBC,
  28                                       LinearCombinationBC)
  29from femtoscope.misc.util import concatenate, copy_list_of_arrays
  30import sfepy.discrete.fem.periodic as per
  31from sfepy.discrete.common.mappings import get_physical_qps # get_normals
  32import numpy as np
  33from sfepy.base.base import output
  34
  35output.set_output(quiet=True) # Toggle for Sfepy console's messages
  36
  37
  38class Solver:
  39    """
  40    Class for performing FEM simulations.
  41
  42    Attributes
  43    ----------
  44    eps_dic : dict
  45        Dictionary with keys 'eps_a' and 'eps_r' corresponding to the absolute
  46        and relative tolerance settings respectively.
  47        The default is {'eps_a' : 1e-10, 'eps_r' : 1.0}
  48    ls : `sfepy.solvers.ls.ScipyDirect` by default.
  49        Linear solver to be used. The default is ScipyDirect.
  50    nls : `sfepy.solvers.nls.Newton`
  51        Nonlinear solver to be used. The default is Newton.
  52    wfs_dic : dict
  53        Dictionary of all weakforms used in the simulation. Item with key
  54        'weakforms' represents the weakforms associated with the PDE to be
  55        solved (1 wf for bounded domains, 2 wfs for unbounded ones). Other
  56        weakforms are for supplementary purposes (evaluation of the strong
  57        residual, line-search...).
  58    nwf : int
  59        Number of weak forms provided to the solver.
  60    islinear : bool
  61        Whether or not the PDE to be solved is linear.
  62    is_bounded : bool
  63        Whether or not the domain is bounded.
  64    iter : int, optional
  65        Maximum number of newton/picard iterations (defined if islinear is
  66        False).
  67    initial_guess : list, optional
  68        List of initial guesses (one per weak form) used to initialize
  69        nonlinear solver (defined if islinear is False).The default is a scalar
  70        field set to zero everywhere.
  71    relax : float, optional
  72        Relaxation parameter for newton/picard method (defined if islinear is
  73        False). The default is 0.9.
  74    criteria : `Criteria` instance, optional
  75        Criteria instance gathering the directives for when to stop nonlinear
  76        iterations (defined if islinear is False). The default is to iterate
  77        20 times.
  78    has_converged : bool
  79        False until the Criteria instance decrees convergence has been reached
  80        (defined if islinear is False).
  81    sols : list
  82        List of the solution(s) (one per weak form).
  83    cogammas : list
  84        List of two `sfepy.discrete.common.region.Region` instances
  85        corresponding to the interior and exterior domain common frontier
  86        (defined if nwf = 2).
  87    conn : str
  88        Method for linking the interior domain with the exterior domain
  89        ['connected' , 'ping-pong']. The default is 'connected'.
  90    max_iter_pp : int
  91        Maximum number of iterations for the ping-pong method (defined if
  92        conn = 'ping-pong'). The default is 7.
  93    relax_pp :  float
  94        Relaxation parameter for ping-pong iterations (between 0 and 1).
  95        The default is 0.7.
  96    bounds : list
  97        List of the min & max field values (can be crucial to prevent
  98        divergence in the solution for nonlinear problems).
  99    oldsols : list
 100        List of the solution(s) at the previous iteration (one per weak form).
 101    buffersols : list
 102        Temporary storage of the solution(s).
 103    outfiles : list
 104        List of the exported .vtk files containing simulation results.
 105    save_all_newton : bool
 106        Save all Newton's iterations (for nonlinear problems only).
 107        The default is False.
 108    verbose : bool
 109        Display user's information. The default is False.
 110
 111    """
 112
 113    forbidden_nl_arg = ['update_nl', 'rho', 'rho_vac', 'Rcut', 'solver']
 114    """Class variable `forbidden_nl_arg` is a list of material extra-arguments
 115    (strings) which are not to be interpreted as non-linear terms.
 116    Consequently, material's data will not be updated when calling the function
 117    `update_material` unless the material's function has at least one extra-
 118    argument not contained in that list."""
 119
 120    def __init__(self, wfs_dic, islinear=True, **kwargs):
 121        """
 122        Construct a Solver instance.
 123
 124        Parameters
 125        ----------
 126        weakforms : list
 127            List of one or two WeakForm instances.
 128        islinear : bool, optional
 129            Whether or not the PDE to be solved is linear. The default is True.
 130        kwargs
 131            *Cf class documentation*
 132
 133        """
 134
 135        self.verbose = kwargs.get('verbose', False)
 136        if self.verbose >= 3:
 137            output.set_output(quiet=False) # Display Sfepy console's messages
 138        self.print_kappa =  kwargs.get('print_kappa', False)
 139
 140        # Solver(s) & precision
 141        self.eps_dic = kwargs.get('eps_dic', {'eps_a' : 1e-15,
 142                                              'eps_r' : 1e-15,
 143                                              'i_max' : 5})
 144        # self.ls = kwargs.get('ls', AutoDirect({}))
 145        self.ls = ScipyDirect({})
 146        self.nls = kwargs.get('nls', Newton({'is_linear': False},
 147                                            lin_solver=self.ls,
 148                                            status=IndexedStruct()))
 149        # Weak Forms
 150        self.wfs_dic = wfs_dic
 151        weakforms = wfs_dic['weakforms']
 152        self.weakforms = weakforms if isinstance(weakforms, list) \
 153                                   else [weakforms]
 154        self.nwf = len(self.weakforms)
 155        self.is_bounded = kwargs.get('is_bounded')
 156
 157        # TODO: pre-allocate solutions' arrays
 158        self.oldsols = [None] * self.nwf
 159        self.buffersols = [None] * self.nwf
 160        self.sols = [None] * self.nwf
 161        self.bounds = kwargs.get('bounds', [-1e15, 1e15])
 162
 163        # Non-linear problems
 164        self.islinear = islinear
 165        if not islinear:
 166            wf_res = self.wfs_dic.get('wf_res')
 167            wf_G = self.wfs_dic.get('wf_G')
 168            self.iter = 0
 169            initial_guess = kwargs.get('initial_guess', [])
 170            if len(initial_guess) == 0:
 171                for wf in self.weakforms:
 172                    initial_guess.append(np.zeros(wf.field.n_nod))
 173            elif (self.nwf == 1) and (not isinstance(initial_guess, list)):
 174                initial_guess = [initial_guess]
 175            self.initial_guess = initial_guess
 176            self.oldsols = copy_list_of_arrays(self.initial_guess)
 177            self.relax = kwargs.get('relax', 0.9)
 178            self.criteria = kwargs.get('criteria', StopCriteria(20))
 179            self.has_converged = False
 180            self.save_all_newton = kwargs.get('save_all_newton', False)
 181
 182            # Set materials' extra-arguements
 183            for k, (wf,oldsol) in enumerate(zip(self.weakforms,self.oldsols)):
 184                oldsol_qps = evaluate_at_qps(wf, oldsol)
 185                oldsol_qps[oldsol_qps < self.bounds[0]] = self.bounds[0]
 186                oldsol_qps[oldsol_qps < self.bounds[1]] = self.bounds[1]
 187                set_mat_extra_arg(wf, oldsol_qps, update=False)
 188                if k==0 and wf_res is not None:
 189                    set_mat_extra_arg(wf_res, oldsol_qps, update=False)
 190
 191            # line-search related weak form
 192            self.line_search_bool = (wf_G is not None) \
 193                and kwargs.get('line_search_bool', False)
 194
 195        # Unbounded domains
 196        self.sols = [None] * self.nwf
 197        if self.nwf >= 2:
 198            self.cogammas = kwargs.get('cogammas', None)
 199            self.conn = kwargs.get('conn', 'connected') # or 'ping-pong'
 200            if self.conn == 'ping-pong':
 201                self.max_iter_pp = kwargs.get('max_iter_pp', 7)
 202                self.relax_pp = kwargs.get('relax_pp', 0.7)
 203            elif self.conn == 'connected':
 204                pass
 205            else:
 206                raise Exception("Connection keyword not recognized")
 207        else:
 208            self.conn = None
 209
 210        # Additional initializations
 211        self.init_mtxvec_dic()
 212        self.initialized = False
 213        self.outfiles = None
 214
 215        if self.verbose:
 216            print(self.__str__())
 217
 218    def init_mtxvec_dic(self):
 219        """Initialize the dictionary of all matrices & vectors. The keys
 220        depend on the nature of the simulation (linear or nonlinear, connection
 221        technique, etc.)"""
 222        mtxvec_dic = {}
 223        wf1 = self.weakforms[0]
 224        nwf = self.nwf
 225        if nwf == 1 or (nwf == 2 and self.conn == 'connected'):
 226            mtxvec_dic['mtx'] = None
 227            mtxvec_dic['rhs'] = None
 228            mtxvec_dic['mtx_cst'] = None
 229            mtxvec_dic['rhs_cst'] = None
 230            if wf1.eqn_mod is not None:
 231                mtxvec_dic['mtx_mod'] = None
 232                mtxvec_dic['rhs_mod'] = None
 233        elif nwf == 2 and self.conn == 'ping-pong':
 234            mtxvec_dic['mtx_pp1'] = None
 235            mtxvec_dic['mtx_pp2'] = None
 236            mtxvec_dic['rhs_pp1'] = None
 237            mtxvec_dic['rhs_pp2'] = None
 238            mtxvec_dic['mtx_cst_pp1'] = None
 239            mtxvec_dic['mtx_cst_pp2'] = None
 240            mtxvec_dic['rhs_cst_pp1'] = None
 241            mtxvec_dic['rhs_cst_pp2'] = None
 242            mtxvec_dic['mtx_mod_pp2'] = None
 243            mtxvec_dic['rhs_mod_pp2'] = None
 244            if wf1.eqn_mod is not None:
 245                mtxvec_dic['mtx_mod_pp1'] = None
 246                mtxvec_dic['rhs_mod_pp1'] = None
 247        else:
 248            raise Exception()
 249
 250        wf_res = self.wfs_dic.get('wf_res')
 251        if wf_res is not None:
 252            mtxvec_dic['mtx_res'] = None
 253            mtxvec_dic['rhs_res'] = None
 254            mtxvec_dic['mtx_cst_res'] = None
 255            mtxvec_dic['rhs_cst_res'] = None
 256            if wf_res.eqn_mod is not None:
 257                mtxvec_dic['mtx_mod_res'] = None
 258                mtxvec_dic['rhs_mod_res'] = None
 259
 260        self.mtxvec_dic = mtxvec_dic
 261
 262    def init_problems(self):
 263        """Initialize problem instances. The keys of the `pbs_dic` depend on
 264        the nature of the simulation (linear or nonlinear, connection
 265        technique, etc.)"""
 266
 267        self.pbs_dic = {}
 268        wf1 = self.weakforms[0]
 269
 270        if self.nwf == 1:
 271            ebcs = Conditions(wf1.ebcs)
 272            epbcs = Conditions(wf1.epbcs)
 273            eqs_cst = Equations([wf1.eqn_cst])
 274            pb_cst = Problem('pb_cst', equations=eqs_cst, active_only=True)
 275            pb_cst.set_bcs(ebcs=ebcs, epbcs=epbcs)
 276            pb_cst.set_solver(self.nls)
 277            self.pbs_dic['pb_cst'] = pb_cst
 278            if wf1.eqn_mod is not None:
 279                eqs_mod = Equations([wf1.eqn_mod])
 280                pb_mod = Problem('pb_mod', equations=eqs_mod, active_only=True)
 281                pb_mod.set_bcs(ebcs=ebcs, epbcs=epbcs)
 282                pb_mod.set_solver(self.nls)
 283                self.pbs_dic['pb_mod'] = pb_mod
 284
 285        elif self.nwf == 2:
 286            wf2 = self.weakforms[1]
 287
 288            if self.conn == 'connected':
 289                def zero_shift(ts, coors, region):
 290                    return np.zeros_like(coors[:, 0], dtype=np.float64)
 291                match_coors = Function('match_coors', per.match_coors)
 292                shift_fun = Function('shift_fun', zero_shift)
 293                lcbcs = Conditions(
 294                    [LinearCombinationBC('lc12', self.cogammas,
 295                    {'%s.all' %wf1.unknown_name : '%s.all' %wf2.unknown_name},
 296                    match_coors, 'shifted_periodic', arguments=(shift_fun,))])
 297                ebcs = Conditions(concatenate([wf1.ebcs, wf2.ebcs]))
 298                epbcs = Conditions(concatenate([wf1.epbcs, wf2.epbcs]))
 299                eqs_cst = Equations([wf1.eqn_cst, wf2.eqn_cst])
 300                pb_cst = Problem('pb_cst', equations=eqs_cst, active_only=True)
 301                pb_cst.set_bcs(ebcs=ebcs, epbcs=epbcs, lcbcs=lcbcs)
 302                pb_cst.set_solver(self.nls)
 303                self.pbs_dic['pb_cst'] = pb_cst
 304                if wf2.eqn_mod is not None:
 305                    eqs_mod = Equations([wf1.eqn_mod, wf2.eqn_mod])
 306                    pb_mod = Problem('pb_mod', equations=eqs_mod,
 307                                     active_only=True)
 308                    pb_mod.set_bcs(ebcs=ebcs, epbcs=epbcs, lcbcs=lcbcs)
 309                    pb_mod.set_solver(self.nls)
 310                    self.pbs_dic['pb_mod'] = pb_mod
 311
 312            elif self.conn == 'ping-pong':
 313                pb_cst_pp1 = Problem('pb_cst_pp1',
 314                                     equations=Equations([wf1.eqn_cst]),
 315                                     active_only=True)
 316                pb_cst_pp1.set_bcs(ebcs=Conditions(wf1.ebcs),
 317                                   epbcs=Conditions(wf1.epbcs))
 318                pb_cst_pp1.set_solver(self.nls)
 319                self.pbs_dic['pb_cst_pp1'] = pb_cst_pp1
 320
 321                pb_cst_pp2 = Problem('pb_cst_pp2',
 322                                     equations=Equations([wf2.eqn_cst]),
 323                                     active_only=True)
 324                pb_cst_pp2.set_bcs(ebcs=Conditions(wf2.ebcs),
 325                                   epbcs=Conditions(wf2.epbcs))
 326                pb_cst_pp2.set_solver(self.nls)
 327                self.pbs_dic['pb_cst_pp2'] = pb_cst_pp2
 328
 329                pb_mod_pp2 = Problem('pb_mod_pp2',
 330                                    equations=Equations([wf2.eqn_mod]),
 331                                    active_only=True)
 332                pb_mod_pp2.set_bcs(ebcs=Conditions(wf2.ebcs),
 333                                   epbcs=Conditions(wf2.epbcs))
 334                pb_mod_pp2.set_solver(self.nls)
 335                self.pbs_dic['pb_mod_pp2'] = pb_mod_pp2
 336
 337                if wf1.eqn_mod is not None:
 338                    pb_mod_pp1 = Problem('pb_mod_pp1',
 339                                        equations=Equations([wf1.eqn_mod]),
 340                                        active_only=True)
 341                    pb_mod_pp1.set_bcs(ebcs=Conditions(wf1.ebcs),
 342                                       epbcs=Conditions(wf1.epbcs))
 343                    pb_mod_pp1.set_solver(self.nls)
 344                    self.pbs_dic['pb_mod_pp1'] = pb_mod_pp1
 345
 346            else:
 347                raise Exception("Connection keyword not recognized")
 348
 349        wf_res = self.wfs_dic.get('wf_res')
 350        if wf_res is not None:
 351            pb_cst_res = Problem('pb_cst_res',
 352                                 equations=Equations([wf_res.eqn_cst]),
 353                                 active_only=False)
 354            pb_cst_res.set_bcs(ebcs=Conditions(wf_res.ebcs),
 355                               epbcs=Conditions(wf_res.epbcs))
 356            pb_cst_res.set_solver(self.nls)
 357            self.pbs_dic['pb_cst_res'] = pb_cst_res
 358
 359            pb_mod_res = Problem('pb_mod_res',
 360                                 equations=Equations([wf_res.eqn_mod]),
 361                                 active_only=False)
 362            pb_mod_res.set_bcs(ebcs=Conditions(wf_res.ebcs),
 363                               epbcs=Conditions(wf_res.epbcs))
 364            pb_mod_res.set_solver(self.nls)
 365            self.pbs_dic['pb_mod_res'] = pb_mod_res
 366
 367        wf_G = self.wfs_dic.get('wf_G')
 368        if wf_G is not None:
 369            pb_cst_G = Problem('pb_cst_G',
 370                                equations=Equations([wf_G.eqn_cst]),
 371                                active_only=False)
 372            pb_cst_G.set_bcs(ebcs=Conditions(wf_G.ebcs),
 373                              epbcs=Conditions(wf_G.epbcs))
 374            pb_cst_G.set_solver(self.nls)
 375            self.pbs_dic['pb_cst_G'] = pb_cst_G
 376
 377            pb_mod_G = Problem('pb_mod_G',
 378                                equations=Equations([wf_G.eqn_mod]),
 379                                active_only=False)
 380            pb_mod_G.set_bcs(ebcs=Conditions(wf_G.ebcs),
 381                              epbcs=Conditions(wf_G.epbcs))
 382            pb_mod_G.set_solver(self.nls)
 383            self.pbs_dic['pb_mod_G'] = pb_mod_G
 384
 385    def init_mtxvec(self):
 386        """Assemble all matrices and vectors. These objects are then accessible
 387        through the `self.mtxvec_dic` dictionary."""
 388        pb_list = list(self.pbs_dic.values())
 389        for pb in list(pb_list):
 390            if pb.name=='pb_cst_G' or pb.name=='pb_mod_G':
 391                pb_list.remove(pb)
 392        assemble_mtxvec(self, *pb_list)
 393
 394    def update_mtxvec(self):
 395        """Re-assemble matrices and vectors associated with terms featured in
 396        `eqn_mod` equations from all weak forms."""
 397        pb_list = []
 398        for pb in list(self.pbs_dic.values()):
 399            pb_name = pb.name
 400            if pb_name.split('_')[1]=='mod' and \
 401                (pb_name!='pb_cst_G' or pb_name!='pb_mod_G'):
 402                pb_list.append(pb)
 403        assemble_mtxvec(self, *pb_list)
 404
 405    def solve(self, **kwargs):
 406        """Launch the FEM computation!"""
 407        if self.islinear:
 408            lsolve(self)
 409        else:
 410            nlsolve(self, **kwargs)
 411
 412    def save(self, grad=False, **kwargs):
 413        """
 414        Save the results to vtk. This routine is a wrapper for
 415        `femtoscope.inout.vtkfactory.createStructuredVTK`, which itself rely
 416        on meshio.
 417        Warning: the connectivity is reconstructed from scratch
 418
 419        Parameters
 420        ----------
 421        grad : bool, optional
 422            Save the gradient of the scalar field. The default is False.
 423        name : str, optional
 424            Name of the output file (prefix).
 425            
 426        Returns
 427        -------
 428        out : list
 429            Result file names.
 430
 431        """
 432
 433        from femtoscope.inout.vtkfactory import createStructuredVTK
 434        from femtoscope.misc.util import merge_dicts
 435        from pathlib import Path
 436        val_renorm = kwargs.get('val_renorm', 1.0)
 437        grad_renorm = kwargs.get('grad_renorm', 1.0)
 438        name = Path((kwargs.get('name', '')))
 439        if name.name:
 440            name = str(name.with_suffix(''))
 441        else:
 442            name = ''
 443        dim = self.weakforms[0].dimension
 444        out = []
 445        for kk, (wf, sol) in enumerate(zip(self.weakforms, self.sols)):
 446            vars_dic = {}
 447            # Retrieve coordinates and connectivity
 448            pos = wf.field.get_coor() # also works with pos = field.coors
 449            X = pos[:, 0]
 450            Y = pos[:, 1]
 451            Z = pos[:, 2] if pos.shape[1]==3 else None
 452            if dim == 2:
 453                from matplotlib.tri import Triangulation
 454                cells = Triangulation(X, Y).triangles
 455            elif dim == 3:
 456                from scipy.spatial import Delaunay
 457                cells = Delaunay(pos).vertices
 458            vars_dic[wf.unknown_name] = val_renorm * sol
 459            if grad:
 460                gradsol = grad_renorm * wf.field.evaluate_at(
 461                    pos, sol[:, np.newaxis], mode='grad').squeeze()
 462                normgradsol = np.linalg.norm(gradsol, axis=1)
 463                vars_dic['norm_grad_'+wf.unknown_name] = normgradsol
 464                vars_dic['gradX_'+wf.unknown_name] = gradsol[:, 0]
 465                vars_dic['gradY_'+wf.unknown_name] = gradsol[:, 1]
 466                if dim == 3:
 467                    vars_dic['gradZ_'+wf.unknown_name] = gradsol[:, 2]
 468            if (kk==0) and (not self.islinear):
 469                vars_dic['residual'] = self.criteria.res_vec.data
 470                merge_dicts(vars_dic, self.criteria.res_vec_parts)
 471            out.append(createStructuredVTK(
 472                X, Y, Z, vars_dic, cells, name=name+'_'+wf.name))
 473        self.outfiles = out
 474        return out
 475    
 476    def plot_residual(self, log=False):
 477        """
 478        Plot the residual vector.
 479        Since 22/05/23, it is no longer necessary to remove ebc-DOFs from the
 480        coordinate array. The residual vector is not cropped anymore but
 481        contains NaN values instead.
 482
 483        Parameters
 484        ----------
 485        log : bool, optional
 486            If True, plot the log of the absolute value of the residual vector.
 487            The default is False.
 488
 489        Returns
 490        -------
 491        ax : Axes
 492            Figure axe.
 493
 494        """
 495        from matplotlib import pyplot as plt
 496        dim = self.weakforms[0].dimension
 497        res_vec = np.copy(self.criteria.res_vec)
 498        coors = self.weakforms[0].field.coors
 499        if log:
 500            res_vec = np.log(abs(res_vec))
 501        
 502        plt.figure(figsize=(6,5))
 503        if dim == 1:
 504            plt.scatter(coors.squeeze(), res_vec, s=1)
 505            plt.xlabel(r"$r$", fontsize=15)
 506            plt.ylabel("Residual", fontsize=15)
 507        elif dim == 2:
 508            plt.scatter(coors[:, 0], coors[:, 1], c=res_vec, s=1)
 509            plt.colorbar(label="Residual")
 510        else:
 511            raise ValueError("Cannot plot residual for dimension %d" %dim)
 512        ax = plt.gca()
 513        plt.show()
 514        return ax
 515
 516    def display(self, grad=False, **kwargs):
 517        """
 518        Display FEM results. The `solve` method must have been called on the
 519        Solver instance beforehand.
 520
 521        Parameters
 522        ----------
 523        grad : bool, optional
 524            Save the gradient of the scalar field. The default is False.
 525        kwargs :
 526            Potential extra arguments (to be added in the future).
 527
 528        Returns
 529        -------
 530        None.
 531
 532        """
 533        from femtoscope.display.fea_plot import plot_from_vtk
 534        if self.outfiles is None:
 535            self.save(grad=grad)
 536            delete = True
 537        for out in self.outfiles:
 538            plot_from_vtk(out, **kwargs)
 539            if delete:
 540                os.remove(out)
 541
 542    def __str__(self):
 543        from femtoscope.misc.util import remove_empty_lines
 544        string = f"""
 545        Solver:
 546            # weak-form(s): {self.nwf}
 547        """
 548
 549        if self.is_bounded:
 550            string += f"""
 551            bounded domain
 552            """
 553        else:
 554            string += f"""
 555            unbounded domain
 556            """
 557
 558        if self.conn == 'ping-pong':
 559            string += f"""
 560            ping-pong max iter: {self.max_iter_pp}
 561            """
 562
 563        if self.islinear:
 564            string += f"""
 565            is linear?: YES
 566            """
 567        else:
 568            string += f"""
 569            is linear?: NO
 570            relax parameter: {self.relax}
 571            """
 572            string += self.criteria.__str__()
 573
 574        return remove_empty_lines(string)
 575
 576
 577class StopCriteria:
 578    """
 579    Class defining stopping conditions for nonlinear problems.
 580
 581    Attributes
 582    ----------
 583    min_iter : int
 584        Minimum number of Newton iterations. The default is 8.
 585    max_iter : int
 586        Maximum number of Newton iterations.
 587    sol_delta_tol : float
 588        Threshold on the minimum relative distance (in 2-norm) between two
 589        successive iterations.
 590    active_dic : dict
 591        Dictionary for knowing which criteria are active and which are not.
 592    verbose : bool
 593        Display user's information. The default is False.
 594    stop : bool
 595        False until some stopping criterion is met.
 596    res_vec : ndarray
 597        Current strong residual vector.
 598    res_vec_parts : dic
 599        Dictionary with keys ('mtx', 'rhs_cst', 'rhs_mod') and values each term
 600        of the strong residual vector.
 601    res : float
 602        Current value of the strong residual (L2-norm).
 603    sol_delta : float
 604        Current value of the relative distance between two successive
 605        iterations.
 606    history : list of dicts
 607        List of dictionaries containing all the above parameters for monitoring
 608        convergence.
 609    last_relax_update : List of int
 610        Last iteration number for which the relaxation parameter of the Newton
 611        method was decreased.
 612
 613    """
 614
 615    def __init__(self, max_iter, min_iter=8, **kwargs):
 616        self.max_iter = max_iter if max_iter is not None else 50
 617        self.min_iter = min_iter if min_iter is not None else 8
 618        self.res_delta_tol = None
 619        self.sol_delta_tol = None
 620        self.stop = False
 621        self.res_vec = None
 622        self.res_vec_parts = None
 623        self.res = None
 624        self.sol_delta = None
 625        self.history = []
 626        self.last_relax_update = [0]
 627
 628        # Dictionary of active stopping criteria
 629        active_dic = {}
 630        active_dic['res_delta_tol'] = ('res_delta_tol' in kwargs)
 631        if active_dic['res_delta_tol']:
 632            self.res_delta_tol = kwargs.get('res_delta_tol')
 633        active_dic['sol_delta_tol'] = ('sol_delta_tol' in kwargs)
 634        if active_dic['sol_delta_tol']:
 635            self.sol_delta_tol = kwargs.get('sol_delta_tol')
 636        self.active_dic = active_dic
 637
 638        self.verbose = kwargs.get('verbose', True)
 639
 640    def __str__(self):
 641        return f"""
 642        Stop Criteria:
 643            max iter: {self.max_iter}
 644            relative delta_sol tolerance: {self.sol_delta_tol}
 645            relative delta_res tolerance: {self.res_delta_tol}
 646        """
 647
 648    def evaluate(self, solver):
 649        """
 650        Evaluate all the criteria set active. Some additional indicators are
 651        computed but are intended for information purposes only.
 652
 653        Parameters
 654        ----------
 655        solver : `Solver` instance
 656            The solver instance.
 657
 658        Returns
 659        -------
 660        bool
 661            True if one of the stopping criterion has been met, False otherwise.
 662
 663        """
 664
 665        # Set to None
 666        sol_delta = None
 667        res_delta = None
 668        res_L2 = None
 669        res_mean = None
 670        res_inf = None
 671
 672        # strong residual evaluation
 673        res_vec, res_vec_parts = strong_residual(solver, solver.sols[0])
 674        res_L2 = np.sqrt((res_vec**2).sum())
 675        res_mean = np.mean(abs(res_vec))
 676        res_inf = abs(res_vec).max()
 677        if self.res_vec is not None:
 678            res_delta = np.sqrt(((res_vec-self.res_vec)**2).sum()) / self.res
 679        else:
 680            res_delta = np.nan
 681
 682        # distance between two successive iterations
 683        if solver.iter > 0:
 684            delta = 0.0
 685            denominator = 0.0
 686            for oldsol, newsol in zip(solver.oldsols, solver.sols):
 687                if (oldsol is not None) and (newsol is not None):
 688                    delta += np.linalg.norm(newsol-oldsol)
 689                    denominator += np.linalg.norm(oldsol)
 690            sol_delta = delta / denominator
 691        else:
 692            sol_delta = np.nan
 693
 694        self.sol_delta = sol_delta
 695        self.res = res_L2
 696        self.res_vec = res_vec
 697        self.res_vec_parts = res_vec_parts
 698
 699        if solver.verbose:
 700            print("{0: <17} {1:.3E}".format("Sol rel delta", sol_delta))
 701            print("{0: <17} {1:.3E}".format("Residual L2", res_L2))
 702            print("{0: <17} {1:.3E}".format("Residual mean", res_mean))
 703            print("{0: <17} {1:.3E}".format("Residual inf", res_inf))
 704            print("{0: <17} {1:.3E}\n".format("Residual rel delta", res_delta))
 705
 706        self.fill_history(solver.iter, sol_delta, res_delta, res_L2, res_mean,
 707                          res_inf)
 708
 709        # Active criteria
 710        if self.active_dic['sol_delta_tol'] and solver.iter > self.min_iter:
 711            if sol_delta < self.sol_delta_tol:
 712                self.stop = True
 713                solver.has_converged = True
 714                if self.verbose:
 715                    print("STOP: Delta in successive iterations is small")
 716                return True
 717
 718        if self.active_dic['res_delta_tol'] and solver.iter > self.min_iter:
 719            if res_delta < self.res_delta_tol:
 720                self.stop = True
 721                solver.has_converged = True
 722                if self.verbose:
 723                    print("STOP: Residual variation is small")
 724                return True
 725
 726        if solver.iter >= self.max_iter:
 727            self.stop = True
 728            if self.verbose:
 729                print("STOP: Maximum number of iteration has been reached")
 730            return True
 731
 732        return False
 733
 734    def fill_history(self, niter, sol_delta, res_delta, res_L2, res_mean,
 735                     res_inf):
 736        iter_dic = {
 737            'iter': niter,
 738            'sol delta' : sol_delta,
 739            'res delta' : res_delta,
 740            'res L2' : res_L2,
 741            'res mean' : res_mean,
 742            'res inf' : res_inf
 743            }
 744        if self.history == []:
 745            iter_dic['res_k / res_0 (%)'] = 100
 746        else:
 747            iter_dic['res_k / res_0 (%)'] = res_L2/self.history[0]['res L2']*100
 748        self.history.append(iter_dic)
 749
 750    def adjust_relax(self, solver, history_size=2, factor=0.8):
 751        """
 752        Based on the analyis of the current convergence-history of the on-going
 753        nonlinear equation solving, the relaxation parameter manually decreased
 754        to achieve convergence of Newton's iterations. The two following
 755        conditions must be satisfied simultaneously:
 756            - the relative delta has stopped decreasing
 757            - the residual in 2-norm has stopped decreasing
 758
 759        Parameters
 760        ----------
 761        solver : `Solver` instance
 762            The solver instance.
 763        history_size : int, optional
 764            Number of past iteration used to check the two stalling conditions.
 765            The default is 3.
 766        factor : float, optional
 767            Factor by which the relaxation parameter is multiplied (should be
 768            strictly smaller than 1). The default value is 0.8.
 769        """
 770        
 771        assert factor < 1 and factor > 0
 772        if solver.iter > history_size + self.last_relax_update[-1] - 1:
 773            res_L2 = np.array([self.history[-k]['res L2'] for k in range(history_size, 0, -1)])
 774            sol_delta = np.array([self.history[-k]['sol delta'] for k in range(history_size, 0, -1)])
 775            cond1 = (np.diff(sol_delta)/sol_delta.max() > -1e-2).any()
 776            cond2 = (np.diff(res_L2)/np.mean(res_L2) > -1e-2).any()
 777            if cond1 and cond2:
 778                if len(self.last_relax_update) > 10:
 779                    factor *= 1e-2
 780                elif len(self.last_relax_update) > 7:
 781                    factor *= 0.25
 782                elif len(self.last_relax_update) > 4:
 783                    factor *= 0.5
 784                solver.relax *= factor
 785                self.last_relax_update.append(solver.iter)
 786                if solver.verbose:
 787                    print("! Decreasing relax. param. to {:.3f} !\n".format(
 788                        solver.relax))
 789        
 790
 791def lsolve(solver, buffer=False):
 792    """
 793    Linear solve function.
 794
 795    Parameters
 796    ----------
 797    solver : `Solver` instance
 798        The solver instance.
 799    buffer : bool, optional
 800        If True, the computed solution is kept in *solver.buffersols*. This is
 801        only relevant to nonlinear problems. The way the buffer is unload into
 802        *solver.sols* depends on the nonlinear method implementation.
 803        The default is False.
 804
 805    """
 806
 807    # Retrieve tolerance settings
 808    eps_a = solver.eps_dic['eps_a']
 809    eps_r = solver.eps_dic['eps_r']
 810    i_max = solver.eps_dic['i_max']
 811    mtxvec_dic = solver.mtxvec_dic
 812
 813    # Setup problem instances & assemble matrices / vectors
 814    if not solver.initialized:
 815        solver.init_problems()
 816        solver.init_mtxvec()
 817        solver.initialized = True
 818
 819    nwf = solver.nwf
 820    status = IndexedStruct()
 821    update_global_mtxvec(solver)
 822    ls = solver.nls.lin_solver
 823
 824    # Single domain
 825    if nwf == 1:
 826        pb = solver.pbs_dic['pb_cst']
 827        mtx = mtxvec_dic['mtx']
 828        rhs = mtxvec_dic['rhs']
 829        vec_x = ls(rhs, x0=None, eps_a=eps_a, eps_r=eps_r, mtx=mtx,
 830                   status=status)
 831        sol = reconstruct_full_sol(pb, vec_x)
 832        solver.buffersols[0] = sol
 833
 834    # Double domain
 835    elif nwf == 2:
 836        wf1 = solver.weakforms[0]
 837        wf2 = solver.weakforms[1]
 838
 839        # Virtual connection of DOFs at the boundary
 840        if solver.conn == 'connected':
 841            pb = solver.pbs_dic['pb_cst']
 842            mtx = mtxvec_dic['mtx']
 843            rhs = mtxvec_dic['rhs']
 844            vec_x = ls(rhs, x0=None, eps_a=eps_a, eps_r=eps_r, mtx=mtx,
 845                       i_max=i_max, status=status)
 846            sol = reconstruct_full_sol(pb, vec_x)
 847            solver.buffersols[0] = sol[:wf1.field.n_nod]
 848            solver.buffersols[1] = sol[wf1.field.n_nod:]
 849
 850        # DtN / NtD iterations ('ping-pong')
 851        elif solver.conn == 'ping-pong':
 852            theta = solver.relax_pp
 853            convergence_flag = False
 854            old_pp1 = np.empty(solver.weakforms[0].field.n_nod)
 855            old_pp2 = np.empty(solver.weakforms[1].field.n_nod)
 856            pb_cst_pp1 = solver.pbs_dic['pb_cst_pp1']
 857            pb_cst_pp2 = solver.pbs_dic['pb_cst_pp2']
 858            
 859            for k in range(solver.max_iter_pp):
 860
 861                # Dirichlet BC on interior domain
 862                mtx_pp1 = mtxvec_dic['mtx_pp1']
 863                rhs_pp1 = mtxvec_dic['rhs_pp1']
 864                vec_x_pp1 = ls(rhs_pp1, x0=None, eps_a=eps_a, eps_r=eps_r,
 865                               mtx=mtx_pp1, status=status)
 866                sol_pp1 = reconstruct_full_sol(pb_cst_pp1, vec_x_pp1)
 867                solver.sols[0] = sol_pp1
 868
 869                # Neumann BC on inversed exterior domain
 870                update_neumann(wf2, solver.cogammas[1])
 871                assemble_mtxvec(solver, solver.pbs_dic['pb_mod_pp2'],
 872                                assemble_mtx=False) # do not rebuild matrices!
 873
 874                mtx_mod_pp2 = mtxvec_dic.get('mtx_mod_pp2')
 875                if mtx_mod_pp2 is not None:
 876                    mtx_pp2 = mtxvec_dic['mtx_cst_pp2'] + mtx_mod_pp2
 877                else:
 878                    mtx_pp2 = mtxvec_dic['mtx_cst_pp2']
 879
 880                rhs_mod_pp2 = mtxvec_dic.get('rhs_mod_pp2')
 881                if rhs_mod_pp2 is not None:
 882                    rhs_pp2 = mtxvec_dic['rhs_cst_pp2'] + rhs_mod_pp2
 883                else:
 884                    rhs_pp2 = mtxvec_dic['rhs_cst_pp2']
 885
 886                vec_x_pp2 = ls(rhs_pp2, x0=None, eps_a=eps_a, eps_r=eps_r,
 887                               mtx=mtx_pp2, status=status)
 888                sol_pp2 = reconstruct_full_sol(pb_cst_pp2, vec_x_pp2)
 889
 890                # Reset Dirichlet BC on the interior domain using the solution
 891                # on the inversed exterior domain that we just calculated...
 892                if k >= 1:
 893                    sol_relax = theta*sol_pp2 + (1-theta)*old_pp2
 894                else:
 895                    sol_relax = sol_pp2
 896                reset_dirichlet(sol_relax, wf1, wf2, solver.cogammas)
 897                pb_cst_pp1.set_bcs(ebcs=Conditions(wf1.ebcs),
 898                                   epbcs=Conditions(wf1.epbcs))
 899                pb_cst_pp1.equations.variables.apply_ebc()
 900                pb_mod_pp1 = solver.pbs_dic.get('pb_mod_pp1')
 901                if pb_mod_pp1 is not None:
 902                    pb_mod_pp1.set_bcs(ebcs=Conditions(wf1.ebcs),
 903                                       epbcs=Conditions(wf1.epbcs))
 904                    pb_mod_pp1.equations.variables.apply_ebc()
 905
 906                # ... which involves re-assembling rhs vectors
 907                assemble_mtxvec(solver, pb_cst_pp1, assemble_mtx=False)
 908                assemble_mtxvec(solver, pb_mod_pp1)
 909                update_global_mtxvec(solver)
 910                
 911                # check if convergence has been reached
 912                if k >= 1:
 913                    norm_delta1 = np.linalg.norm(sol_pp1-old_pp1)
 914                    norm_delta2 = np.linalg.norm(sol_pp2-old_pp2)
 915                    norm_old1 = np.linalg.norm(old_pp1)
 916                    norm_old2 = np.linalg.norm(old_pp2)
 917                    rel_delta = norm_delta1/norm_old1 + norm_delta2/norm_old2
 918                    convergence_flag = rel_delta < 1e-8
 919                
 920                # update auxiliary array
 921                old_pp1 = sol_pp1.copy()
 922                old_pp2 = sol_pp2.copy()
 923                
 924                if convergence_flag:
 925                    if solver.verbose>1 or (solver.verbose and solver.islinear):
 926                        print("ping-pong convergence in {} iter".format(k+1))
 927                    break
 928
 929            solver.buffersols[0] = sol_pp1
 930            solver.buffersols[1] = sol_pp2
 931
 932        else:
 933            raise Exception("%s is not implemented" %solver.conn)
 934
 935    else:
 936        raise Exception("femtoscope cannot deal with more than 2 domains")
 937
 938    if not buffer:
 939        solver.sols = [x for x in solver.buffersols]
 940        
 941    # compute the condition number of the stifness matrix
 942    if solver.print_kappa:
 943        from scipy.sparse.linalg import eigsh
 944        if solver.conn == 'ping-pong':
 945            mtx = mtxvec_dic['mtx_pp1']
 946        max_eig = eigsh(mtx, return_eigenvectors=False, which='LM', k=1)[0]
 947        sigma = 1e-8
 948        min_eig = eigsh(mtx, return_eigenvectors=False, sigma=sigma).min()
 949        counter = 0
 950        while min_eig < sigma and counter < 10:
 951            sigma /= 100
 952            min_eig = eigsh(mtx, return_eigenvectors=False, sigma=sigma).min()
 953            counter += 1
 954        if counter == 10:
 955            import warnings
 956            warnings.warn("Could not compute the condition number!")
 957        else:
 958            kappa = abs(max_eig/min_eig)
 959            print("Matrix condition number = {:.2e}".format(kappa))
 960
 961
 962def nlsolve(solver, **kwargs):
 963    """
 964    Nonlinear solve function based on Newton iterations. Each iteration is
 965    associated with a linear problem that is solved by calling the `solve()`
 966    function.
 967
 968    Parameters
 969    ----------
 970    solver : `Solver` instance
 971        The solver instance.
 972        
 973    Other Parameters
 974    ----------------
 975    save_all_newton : bool, optional
 976        If true, save all Newton's iterations (solution, residual...).
 977        The default is False.
 978
 979    Returns
 980    -------
 981    None.
 982
 983    """
 984
 985    import pandas as pd
 986    save_all_newton = kwargs.get('save_all_newton', False)
 987    solver.save_all_newton = save_all_newton
 988    if save_all_newton:
 989        from pathlib import Path
 990        from femtoscope import RESULT_DIR
 991        from femtoscope.misc.util import mkdir_p, date_string
 992        dirname = "newton-it_" + date_string()
 993        dirpath = str(Path(RESULT_DIR/dirname))
 994        mkdir_p(dirpath)
 995    stop_criteria = solver.criteria
 996    sol_min = solver.bounds[0]
 997    sol_max = solver.bounds[1]
 998    
 999    if solver.verbose:
1000        print(' Iteration no {} '.format(0).center(40,'*'))
1001
1002    for _ in range(stop_criteria.max_iter+1):
1003        lsolve(solver, buffer=True)
1004        
1005        # fill history for 0-th iteration
1006        if solver.iter == 0:
1007            for k in range(len(solver.sols)):
1008                solver.sols[k] = np.copy(solver.oldsols[k])
1009            stop_criteria.evaluate(solver)
1010            if save_all_newton:
1011                solver.save(name=dirname+'/iter-{:03d}'.format(0))
1012
1013        solver.iter += 1                
1014        if solver.verbose:
1015            print(' Iteration no {} '.format(solver.iter).center(40,'*'))
1016
1017        # Crop the (buffered) solution to fit interval requirement
1018        for k, sol in enumerate(solver.buffersols):
1019            solver.buffersols[k][np.where(sol<sol_min)[0]] = sol_min
1020            solver.buffersols[k][np.where(sol>sol_max)[0]] = sol_max
1021
1022        w = solver.relax
1023        for k in range(solver.nwf):
1024            solver.sols[k] = w*solver.buffersols[k] + (1-w)*solver.oldsols[k]
1025
1026        # Crop the (new iteration) solution to fit interval requirement
1027        for k, sol in enumerate(solver.sols):
1028            solver.sols[k][np.where(sol<sol_min)[0]] = sol_min
1029            solver.sols[k][np.where(sol>sol_max)[0]] = sol_max
1030
1031        # Update material's data (linearized nonlinear terms)
1032        wf_res = solver.wfs_dic.get('wf_res')
1033        for k in range(len(solver.sols)):
1034            sol_qps = evaluate_at_qps(solver.weakforms[k], solver.sols[k])
1035            sol_qps[np.where(sol_qps<sol_min)[0]] = sol_min
1036            sol_qps[np.where(sol_qps>sol_max)[0]] = sol_max
1037            set_mat_extra_arg(solver.weakforms[k], sol_qps, update=True)
1038            if k==0 and wf_res is not None:
1039                set_mat_extra_arg(wf_res, sol_qps, update=True)
1040
1041        # Re-assemble matrices & vectors and update the dictionary
1042        solver.update_mtxvec()
1043        update_global_mtxvec(solver)
1044        
1045        # if solver.weakforms[0].dimension == 2:
1046        #     hook_writer(solver.weakforms[0].field.coors, solver.sols[0],
1047        #                 solver.criteria.res_vec, solver.iter)
1048
1049        # Stop criteria: do we do one more iteration?
1050        if stop_criteria.evaluate(solver): # NO
1051            stop_criteria.history = pd.DataFrame(stop_criteria.history)
1052            break
1053        else: # YES
1054            for k in range(len(solver.sols)):
1055                solver.oldsols[k] = np.copy(solver.sols[k])
1056                
1057        # Stop criteria: res stagnation --> decrease the relaxation parameter
1058        stop_criteria.adjust_relax(solver)
1059
1060        # Save current Newton iteration
1061        if save_all_newton:
1062            solver.save(name=dirname+'/iter-{:03d}'.format(solver.iter))
1063            
1064        # to_pickle.append(stop_criteria.strong_res_vec)
1065
1066    # Save last Newton iteration
1067    if save_all_newton:
1068        solver.save(name=dirname+'/iter-{:03d}'.format(solver.iter))
1069        
1070    if solver.verbose:
1071        if solver.has_converged:
1072            print("CONVERGENCE in {} iterations\n".format(solver.iter))
1073        else:
1074            print("NO CONVERGENCE after {} iterations\n".format(solver.iter))
1075        print(" Recap of all Iterations ".center(88, '-'))
1076        print(solver.criteria.history.to_string(index=False))
1077
1078def hook_writer(coors, sol, res, no_iter):
1079    import pickle
1080    data_dic = {}
1081    x1 = 1.059
1082    x2 = 1.111
1083    x3 = 1.314
1084    x4 = 4.645
1085    x5 = 6.617
1086    XX = [x1, x2, x3, x4, x5]
1087    XX_str = ['x1', 'x2', 'x3', 'x4', 'x5']
1088    for xx, xx_str in zip(XX, XX_str):
1089        ind_x = np.where(coors[:, 0] == xx)[0]
1090        theta_x = coors[ind_x, 1]
1091        sol_x = sol[ind_x]
1092        ind_sort = theta_x.argsort()
1093        theta_x = theta_x[ind_sort]
1094        sol_x = sol_x[ind_sort]
1095        
1096        if no_iter > 1:
1097            res_x = res[ind_x]
1098            res_x = res_x[ind_sort]
1099            data = np.concatenate(
1100                (theta_x[:, np.newaxis], sol_x[:, np.newaxis],
1101                 res_x[:, np.newaxis]), axis=1)
1102        else:
1103            data = np.concatenate((theta_x[:, np.newaxis],
1104                                   sol_x[:, np.newaxis]), axis=1)
1105        data_dic[xx_str] = data
1106    filename = 'iter\iter{}.pkl'.format(no_iter)
1107    with open(filename, 'wb') as handle:
1108        pickle.dump(data_dic, handle, protocol=pickle.HIGHEST_PROTOCOL)
1109        
1110
1111
1112def line_search(solver, delta):
1113    r"""
1114    WARNING -- EXPERIMENTAL!!
1115    Find the real number w such that $u_{k+1} = w u^* + (1-w) u_{k}$ minimizes
1116    the LÂ² norm of the strong residual.
1117
1118    Parameters
1119    ----------
1120    solver : `Solver` instance
1121        The solver instance.
1122    delta : ndarray
1123        Local direction of descent $\delta u = u^* - u_k$.
1124
1125    Returns
1126    -------
1127    float
1128        The real number w resulting from the line-search algorithm.
1129
1130    """
1131
1132    def fun(solver, delta, w):
1133        sol_w = w*solver.buffersols[0] + (1-w)*solver.oldsols[0]
1134        str_res = strong_residual(solver, sol_w)
1135        G = vec_G(solver, sol_w, delta)
1136        return np.dot(str_res, G)
1137
1138    a = 0
1139    b = 1
1140    fa = fun(solver, delta, a)
1141    fb = fun(solver, delta, b)
1142    if fa*fb > 0:
1143        c = (a*fb - b*fa) / (fb - fa)
1144    else:
1145        for _ in range(5):
1146            c = (a*fb - b*fa) / (fb - fa)
1147            if abs(a-c)<1e-3 or abs(b-c)<1e-3:
1148                break
1149            fc = fun(solver, delta, c)
1150            if fc*fa < 0:
1151                b = c
1152                fb = fc
1153            else:
1154                a = c
1155                fa = fc
1156    if solver.verbose:
1157        print("Line search result w = {}".format(c))
1158    return c
1159
1160def set_mat_extra_arg(wf, *args, keys=None, update=False):
1161    """
1162    Utilitary function for setting material extra arg.
1163
1164    Parameters
1165    ----------
1166    wf : `WeakForm` instance
1167        Weak form containing the materials of interest.
1168    arg : *any type*
1169        Value of the argument to be set.
1170    update : bool, optional
1171        If True, the material data will be re-computed. Typically, it has to be
1172        set to True when called after Sfepy's Problem instanciation.
1173        The default is False.
1174
1175    Returns
1176    -------
1177    None.
1178
1179    """
1180
1181    if len(args) > 1:
1182        assert keys is not None and len(keys)==len(args)
1183        args_dic = dict(zip(keys, args))
1184    else:
1185        arg = args[0]
1186
1187    for mat, term in zip(wf.eqn.collect_materials(), wf.terms):
1188        modified = False
1189        if hasattr(mat, 'extra_args') and mat.extra_args != {}:
1190            extra_args = mat.extra_args # fetch material's extra-args dict
1191            for key in list(extra_args.keys()):
1192                if key not in Solver.forbidden_nl_arg:
1193                    if len(args)==1:
1194                        extra_args[key] = arg
1195                    else:
1196                        extra_args[key] = args_dic[key]
1197                    modified = True
1198            mat.set_extra_args(**extra_args) # reset material's extra-args
1199
1200            # recompute material's data with its new extra-arg
1201            if update and modified:
1202                update_material(mat, term.region, wf.integral)
1203
1204
1205def evaluate_at_qps(wf, sol):
1206    """
1207    Compute an extrapolation of the solution at the domain's quadrature points.
1208
1209    Parameters
1210    ----------
1211    wf : `WeakForm` instance
1212        Weak form associated with the solution field `sol`.
1213    sol : ndarray
1214        1D array containing the solution at DOFs.
1215
1216    Returns
1217    -------
1218    sol_qps : ndarray
1219        1D array containing the values of the solution field at quadrature
1220        points.
1221
1222    """
1223    qps = get_physical_qps(wf.omega, wf.integral)
1224    sol_qps = wf.field.evaluate_at(qps.values, sol[:, np.newaxis]).squeeze()
1225    return sol_qps
1226
1227def update_neumann(wf, gamma):
1228    """
1229    Utility function for updating the Neumann boundary condition term on the
1230    exterior domain. Note that the neumann material function should take the
1231    solver instance as one of its extra-arguments in order to be able to
1232    actually compute the flux of the solution across the interior domain
1233    boundary. This function is only called when dealing with unbounded problems
1234    with `conn` set to 'ping-pong'.
1235
1236    Parameters
1237    ----------
1238    wf : `WeakForm` instance
1239        Weak form whose Neumann boundary condition term is updated.
1240    gamma : `Region` instance
1241        Sub region of dimension D-1 on which the Neumann term is defined.
1242
1243    Returns
1244    -------
1245    None.
1246
1247    """
1248    term_idx = None
1249    for k, term in enumerate(wf.terms):
1250        # check if term is the neumann term
1251        if term.name == 'dw_surface_integrate' and term.region==gamma:
1252            term_idx = k
1253            break
1254    # get neumann term and update its material
1255    mat_neumann = wf.eqn.collect_materials()[term_idx]
1256    update_material(mat_neumann, gamma, wf.integral)
1257
1258
1259def update_material(mat, region, integral):
1260    """
1261    Utility function for updating a material's data at the region quadrature
1262    points.
1263
1264    Parameters
1265    ----------
1266    mat : `Material` instance
1267        The material to be updated.
1268    region : `Region` instance
1269        Region over which the material is defined.
1270    integral : `Integral` instance
1271        Sfepy's Integral class instance (wrapper class around quadratures).
1272
1273    Returns
1274    -------
1275    None.
1276
1277    """
1278    from sfepy.solvers.ts import TimeStepper
1279    dummy_ts = TimeStepper(0, 100) # ficticious time-stepper
1280    qps = get_physical_qps(region, integral)
1281    coors = qps.values
1282    data = mat.function(dummy_ts, coors, mode='qp', **mat.extra_args)
1283    key = (region.name, integral.order)
1284    mat.set_data(key, qps, data)
1285
1286
1287def update_material_all(wf):
1288    """
1289    Utility function for updating all materials' data of a given weak form.
1290
1291    Parameters
1292    ----------
1293    wf : `WeakForm` instance
1294        Weak form whose materials' data are updated.
1295
1296    Returns
1297    -------
1298    None.
1299
1300    """
1301    for mat, term in zip(wf.eqn.collect_materials(), wf.terms):
1302        update_material(mat, term.region, term.integral)
