def strong_residual(solver, sol_w): 
1340def strong_residual(solver, sol_w):
1341    """
1342    Compute the strong residual (for nonlinear problems only). Note that the
1343    strong residual might be evaluated on both the interior and exterior
1344    if two nonlinear WeakForms instances are provided at the creation of
1345    `solver` (unbounded problems only).
1346
1347    Parameters
1348    ----------
1349    solver : `Solver` instance
1350        The solver instance.
1351    sol_w : array
1352        Current solution (vector).
1353
1354    Returns
1355    -------
1356    res_vec : ndarray
1357        Residual vector.
1358
1359    """
1360
1361    # Fetch solution vector and matrix & rhs associated with the residual
1362    wf_res = solver.wfs_dic['wf_res']
1363    cg = solver.cogammas[0] if hasattr(solver, 'cogammas') else None
1364    idx_bc = np.array(get_ebc_dofs(wf_res, gamma=cg))
1365    mtx_res = solver.mtxvec_dic['mtx_res']
1366    rhs_res = solver.mtxvec_dic['rhs_res']
1367    
1368    # Set coeff associated with EBC to zero
1369    # mtx_res[idx_bc, :] = 0.0
1370    # mtx_res[:, idx_bc] = 0.0
1371    # rhs_res[idx_bc] = 0.0
1372    
1373    # Evaluate the residual vector
1374    Ax = mtx_res.dot(sol_w)
1375    res_vec = Ax - rhs_res
1376    res_vec[idx_bc] = np.NaN
1377    res_vec = np.ma.masked_invalid(res_vec)
1378    res_vec_parts = {'mtx' : Ax,
1379                     'rhs_cst' : solver.mtxvec_dic['rhs_cst_res'],
1380                     'rhs_mod' : solver.mtxvec_dic['rhs_mod_res']}
1381
1382    return res_vec, res_vec_parts

Compute the strong residual (for nonlinear problems only). Note that the strong residual might be evaluated on both the interior and exterior if two nonlinear WeakForms instances are provided at the creation of solver (unbounded problems only).

Parameters
  • solver (Solver instance): The solver instance.
  • sol_w (array): Current solution (vector).
Returns
  • res_vec (ndarray): Residual vector.
def vec_G(solver, sol_w, delta): 
1385def vec_G(solver, sol_w, delta):
1386    """Utility function for the line-search algorithm"""
1387    wf1 = solver.weakforms[0]
1388    wf_G = solver.wfs_dic['wf_G']
1389    sol_qps = evaluate_at_qps(wf1, sol_w)
1390    dphi_qps = evaluate_at_qps(wf1, delta)
1391    set_mat_extra_arg(wf_G, sol_qps, dphi_qps,
1392                      keys=('phi', 'dphi'), update=True)
1393    is_not_assembled = solver.mtxvec_dic.get('mtx_cst_G') is None
1394    if is_not_assembled:
1395        assemble_mtxvec(solver, solver.pbs_dic['pb_cst_G'], assemble_rhs=False)
1396    assemble_mtxvec(solver, solver.pbs_dic['pb_mod_G'], assemble_mtx=False)
1397    mtx = solver.mtxvec_dic['mtx_cst_G']
1398    rhs = solver.mtxvec_dic['rhs_mod_G']
1399    vec = mtx.dot(delta) - rhs
1400    cg = solver.cogammas[0] if hasattr(solver, 'cogammas') else None
1401    idx_bc = get_ebc_dofs(wf_G, gamma=cg)
1402    vec = np.delete(vec, idx_bc)
1403    return vec

Utility function for the line-search algorithm

def delete_ebc_dofs(vec, wf, gamma=None): 
1405def delete_ebc_dofs(vec, wf, gamma=None):
1406    """
1407    Remove vector elements that correspond to DOFs subject to essential
1408    boundary conditions or DOFs that are part of a certain facet region
1409    specified by the keyword argument `gamma`.
1410
1411    Parameters
1412    ----------
1413    vec : ndarray
1414        1D numpy array defined over DOFs.
1415    wf : `WeakForm` instance
1416        Weak form instance containing the DOFs info as well as the facet(s)
1417        subject to essential boundary conditions.
1418    gamma : `Region` instance, optional
1419        Extra boundary where `vec` elements should be deleted (a priori not
1420        concerned by ebc). The default is None.
1421
1422    Returns
1423    -------
1424    idx : ndarray
1425        Indices of the DOFs deleted.
1426    ndarray
1427        The amputed version of `vec`.
1428
1429    """
1430    vertices_list = []
1431    for k in range(len(wf.ebcs)):
1432        vertices_list.append(wf.field.get_dofs_in_region(wf.ebcs[k].region))
1433    if gamma is not None:
1434        vertices_list.append(wf.field.get_dofs_in_region(gamma))
1435    idx = np.unique(np.concatenate(vertices_list))
1436    return idx, np.delete(vec, idx)

def assemble_mtxvec(solver, *pbs, assemble_mtx=True, assemble_rhs=True): 
1449def assemble_mtxvec(solver, *pbs, assemble_mtx=True, assemble_rhs=True):
1450    """
1451    Assemble the terms (matrices and vectors) of `Problem` instances (Cf sfepy
1452    API) provided by the user. The assembled matrices and vectors are then
1453    accessible through the solver's `mtxvec_dic` dictionary.
1454
1455    Parameters
1456    ----------
1457    solver : `Solver` instance
1458        The solver instance.
1459    *pbs : list or tupple
1460        List of `Problem` instances.
1461    assemble_mtx : bool, optional
1462        Whether matrices are assembled or not. The default is True.
1463    assemble_rhs : bool, optional
1464        Whether vectors are assembled or not. The default is True.
1465
1466    Returns
1467    -------
1468    None.
1469
1470    """
1471
1472    saved_assemble_mtx = assemble_mtx
1473    saved_assemble_rhs = assemble_rhs
1474
1475    for pb in pbs:
1476
1477        if pb is None:
1478            continue
1479
1480        # name handling
1481        pb_name = pb.name
1482        sname = pb_name.split('_')
1483        sname.pop(0)
1484        mtx_key = 'mtx_' + '_'.join(sname)
1485        rhs_key = 'rhs_' + '_'.join(sname)
1486
1487        # handling exceptions
1488        if ((solver.islinear and pb.name=='pb_mod_pp2') or 
1489            (not solver.islinear and pb.name=='pb_mod_res')):
1490            assemble_mtx = False
1491        if not solver.initialized and pb.name=='pb_mod_pp2':
1492            assemble_rhs = False
1493        if not(assemble_mtx or assemble_rhs):
1494            continue
1495
1496        # assembling matrix and rhs vector
1497        tss = pb.get_solver()
1498        pb.equations.set_data(None, ignore_unknown=True)
1499        variables = pb.get_initial_state(vec=None)
1500        variables.adof_conns = {}
1501        pb.time_update(tss.ts, is_matrix=(pb.mtx_a is None))
1502        variables.apply_ebc(force_values=None)
1503        pb.update_materials()
1504        ev = pb.get_evaluator()
1505        if assemble_mtx:
1506            mtx = ev.eval_tangent_matrix(variables(), is_full=True)
1507            solver.mtxvec_dic[mtx_key] = mtx
1508        if assemble_rhs:
1509            rhs = -ev.eval_residual(variables(), is_full=True)
1510            solver.mtxvec_dic[rhs_key] = rhs
1511            # alternative way / syntax
1512            # rhs = pb.equations.create_reduced_vec()
1513            # rhs = pb.equations.evaluate(mode='weak', dw_mode='vector',
1514            #                             asm_obj=rhs)
1515            # solver.mtxvec_dic[rhs_key] = -rhs
1516
1517        # reset assembling boolean options
1518        assemble_mtx = saved_assemble_mtx
1519        assemble_rhs = saved_assemble_rhs

Assemble the terms (matrices and vectors) of Problem instances (Cf sfepy API) provided by the user. The assembled matrices and vectors are then accessible through the solver's mtxvec_dic dictionary.

Parameters
  • solver (Solver instance): The solver instance.

  • assemble_rhs (bool, optional): Whether vectors are assembled or not. The default is True.

def update_global_mtxvec(solver): 
1522def update_global_mtxvec(solver):
1523    """Update the global stiffness matrix & rhs vector (those subsequently
1524    passed to the linear solver) which are only sums of pre-computed matrices
1525    & vectors."""
1526    mtxvec_dic = solver.mtxvec_dic
1527    wf1 = solver.weakforms[0]
1528    if solver.nwf==1 or (solver.nwf==2 and solver.conn=='connected'):
1529        if wf1.eqn_mod is None:
1530            mtxvec_dic['mtx'] = mtxvec_dic['mtx_cst']
1531            mtxvec_dic['rhs'] = mtxvec_dic['rhs_cst']
1532        else:
1533            mtxvec_dic['mtx'] = mtxvec_dic['mtx_cst'] + mtxvec_dic['mtx_mod']
1534            mtxvec_dic['rhs'] = mtxvec_dic['rhs_cst'] + mtxvec_dic['rhs_mod']
1535    elif solver.nwf==2 and solver.conn=='ping-pong':
1536        if wf1.eqn_mod is None:
1537            mtxvec_dic['mtx_pp1'] = mtxvec_dic['mtx_cst_pp1']
1538            mtxvec_dic['rhs_pp1'] = mtxvec_dic['rhs_cst_pp1']
1539            mtxvec_dic['mtx_pp2'] = mtxvec_dic['mtx_cst_pp2']
1540            mtxvec_dic['rhs_pp2'] = mtxvec_dic['rhs_cst_pp2']
1541        else:
1542            mtxvec_dic['mtx_pp1'] = mtxvec_dic['mtx_cst_pp1'] \
1543                + mtxvec_dic['mtx_mod_pp1']
1544            mtxvec_dic['rhs_pp1'] = mtxvec_dic['rhs_cst_pp1'] \
1545                + mtxvec_dic['rhs_mod_pp1']
1546
1547    wf_res = solver.wfs_dic.get('wf_res')
1548    if wf_res is not None:
1549        if wf_res.eqn_mod is None:
1550            mtxvec_dic['mtx_res'] = mtxvec_dic['mtx_cst_res']
1551            mtxvec_dic['rhs_res'] = mtxvec_dic['rhs_cst_res']
1552        else:
1553            mtxvec_dic['mtx_res'] = mtxvec_dic['mtx_cst_res'] #+ mtxvec_dic['mtx_mod_res']
1554            mtxvec_dic['rhs_res'] = mtxvec_dic['rhs_cst_res'] \
1555                + mtxvec_dic['rhs_mod_res']

def reconstruct_full_sol(pb, sol_reduced): 
1558def reconstruct_full_sol(pb, sol_reduced):
1559    """
1560    Reconstruct the full solution vector from the reduced solution vector
1561    (defined only at active DOFs i.e. DOFs that are not constrained by
1562    essential boundary conditions).
1563
1564    Parameters
1565    ----------
1566    pb : `Problem` instance
1567        Problem instance associated with the solution to reconstruct.
1568    sol_reduced : ndarray
1569        Reduced solution vector.
1570
1571    Returns
1572    -------
1573    sol_full : ndarray
1574        Solution vector defined on all DOFs.
1575
1576    """
1577    pb.equations.variables.set_state(sol_reduced, reduced=True)
1578    sol_full = pb.equations.variables()
1579    return sol_full

Reconstruct the full solution vector from the reduced solution vector (defined only at active DOFs i.e. DOFs that are not constrained by essential boundary conditions).

Parameters
  • pb (Problem instance): Problem instance associated with the solution to reconstruct.
  • sol_reduced (ndarray): Reduced solution vector.
Returns
  • sol_full (ndarray): Solution vector defined on all DOFs.
